segment.source: Planning GPO Deployment (Windows 10)
segment.target: Planning GPO Deployment (Windows 10)

segment.source: Planning GPO Deployment
segment.target: Planning GPO Deployment

segment.source: Planning GPO Deployment
segment.target: Planning GPO Deployment

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: You can control which GPOs are applied to devices in Active Directory in a combination of three ways:
segment.target: You can control which GPOs are applied to devices in Active Directory in a combination of three ways:

segment.source: Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.
segment.target: Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.

segment.source: This involves linking the GPO to a specific OU in the Active Directory OU hierarchy.
segment.target: This involves linking the GPO to a specific OU in the Active Directory OU hierarchy.

segment.source: All devices in the OU and its subordinate containers receive and apply the GPO.
segment.target: All devices in the OU and its subordinate containers receive and apply the GPO.

segment.source: Controlling GPO application through linking to OUs is typically used when you can organize the OU hierarchy according to your domain isolation zone requirements.
segment.target: Controlling GPO application through linking to OUs is typically used when you can organize the OU hierarchy according to your domain isolation zone requirements.

segment.source: GPOs can apply settings to devices based on their location within Active Directory.
segment.target: GPOs can apply settings to devices based on their location within Active Directory.

segment.source: If a device is moved from one OU to another, the policy linked to the second OU will eventually take effect when Group Policy detects the change during polling.
segment.target: If a device is moved from one OU to another, the policy linked to the second OU will eventually take effect when Group Policy detects the change during polling.

segment.source: Security group filtering.
segment.target: Security group filtering.

segment.source: This involves linking the GPOs to the domain level (or other parent OU) in the OU hierarchy, and then selecting which devices receive the GPO by using permissions that only allow correct group members to apply the GPO.
segment.target: This involves linking the GPOs to the domain level (or other parent OU) in the OU hierarchy, and then selecting which devices receive the GPO by using permissions that only allow correct group members to apply the GPO.

segment.source: The security group filters are attached to the GPOs themselves.
segment.target: The security group filters are attached to the GPOs themselves.

segment.source: A group is added to the security group filter of the GPO in Active Directory, and then assigned Read and Apply Group Policy permissions.
segment.target: A group is added to the security group filter of the GPO in Active Directory, and then assigned Read and Apply Group Policy permissions.

segment.source: Other groups can be explicitly denied Read and Apply Group Policy permissions.
segment.target: Other groups can be explicitly denied Read and Apply Group Policy permissions.

segment.source: Only those devices whose group membership are granted Read and Apply Group Policy permissions without any explicit deny permissions can apply the GPO.
segment.target: Only those devices whose group membership are granted Read and Apply Group Policy permissions without any explicit deny permissions can apply the GPO.

segment.source: WMI filtering.
segment.target: WMI filtering.

segment.source: A WMI filter is a query that is run dynamically when the GPO is evaluated.
segment.target: A WMI filter is a query that is run dynamically when the GPO is evaluated.

segment.source: If a device is a member of the result set when the WMI filter query runs, the GPO is applied to the device.
segment.target: If a device is a member of the result set when the WMI filter query runs, the GPO is applied to the device.

segment.source: A WMI filter consists of one or more conditions that are evaluated against the local device.
segment.target: A WMI filter consists of one or more conditions that are evaluated against the local device.

segment.source: You can check almost any characteristic of the device, its operating system, and its installed programs.
segment.target: You can check almost any characteristic of the device, its operating system, and its installed programs.

segment.source: If all of the specified conditions are true for the device, the GPO is applied; otherwise the GPO is ignored.
segment.target: If all of the specified conditions are true for the device, the GPO is applied; otherwise the GPO is ignored.

segment.source: This guide uses a combination of security group filtering and WMI filtering to provide the most flexible options.
segment.target: This guide uses a combination of security group filtering and WMI filtering to provide the most flexible options.

segment.source: If you follow this guidance, even though there might be five different GPOs linked to a specific group because of operating system version differences, only the correct GPO is applied.
segment.target: If you follow this guidance, even though there might be five different GPOs linked to a specific group because of operating system version differences, only the correct GPO is applied.

segment.source: General considerations
segment.target: General considerations

segment.source: Deploy your GPOs before you add any device accounts to the groups that receive the GPOs.
segment.target: Deploy your GPOs before you add any device accounts to the groups that receive the GPOs.

segment.source: That way you can add your devices to the groups in a controlled manner.
segment.target: That way you can add your devices to the groups in a controlled manner.

segment.source: Be sure to add only a few test devices at first.
segment.target: Be sure to add only a few test devices at first.

segment.source: Before adding many group members, examine the results on the test devices and verify that the configured firewall and connection security rules have the effect that you want.
segment.target: Before adding many group members, examine the results on the test devices and verify that the configured firewall and connection security rules have the effect that you want.

segment.source: See the following sections for some suggestions on what to test before you continue.
segment.target: See the following sections for some suggestions on what to test before you continue.

segment.source: Test your deployed groups and GPOs
segment.target: Test your deployed groups and GPOs

segment.source: After you have deployed your GPOs and added some test devices to the groups, confirm the following before you continue with more group members:
segment.target: After you have deployed your GPOs and added some test devices to the groups, confirm the following before you continue with more group members:

segment.source: Examine the GPOs that are both assigned to and filtered from the device.
segment.target: Examine the GPOs that are both assigned to and filtered from the device.

segment.source: Run the gpresult tool at a command prompt.
segment.target: Run the gpresult tool at a command prompt.

segment.source: Examine the rules deployed to the device.
segment.target: Examine the rules deployed to the device.

segment.source: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, and then expand the Firewall and Connection Security nodes.
segment.target: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, and then expand the Firewall and Connection Security nodes.

segment.source: Verify that communications are authenticated.
segment.target: Verify that communications are authenticated.

segment.source: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, expand the Security Associations node, and then click Main Mode.
segment.target: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, expand the Security Associations node, and then click Main Mode.

segment.source: Verify that communications are encrypted when the devices require it.
segment.target: Verify that communications are encrypted when the devices require it.

segment.source: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, expand the Security Associations node, and then select Quick Mode.
segment.target: Open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security MMC snap-in, expand the Monitoring node, expand the Security Associations node, and then select Quick Mode.

segment.source: Encrypted connections display a value other than None in the ESP Confidentiality column.
segment.target: Encrypted connections display a value other than None in the ESP Confidentiality column.

segment.source: Verify that your programs are unaffected.
segment.target: Verify that your programs are unaffected.

segment.source: Run them and confirm that they still work as expected.
segment.target: Run them and confirm that they still work as expected.

segment.source: After you have confirmed that the GPOs have been correctly applied, and that the devices are now communicating by using IPsec network traffic in request mode, you can begin to add more devices to the group accounts, in manageable numbers at a time.
segment.target: After you have confirmed that the GPOs have been correctly applied, and that the devices are now communicating by using IPsec network traffic in request mode, you can begin to add more devices to the group accounts, in manageable numbers at a time.

segment.source: Continue to monitor and confirm the correct application of the GPOs to the devices.
segment.target: Continue to monitor and confirm the correct application of the GPOs to the devices.

segment.source: Do not enable require mode until deployment is complete
segment.target: Do not enable require mode until deployment is complete

segment.source: If you deploy a GPO that requires authentication to a device before the other devices have a GPO deployed, communication between them might not be possible.
segment.target: If you deploy a GPO that requires authentication to a device before the other devices have a GPO deployed, communication between them might not be possible.

segment.source: Wait until you have all the zones and their GPOs deployed in request mode and confirm (as described in the previous section) that the devices are successfully communicating by using IPsec.
segment.target: Wait until you have all the zones and their GPOs deployed in request mode and confirm (as described in the previous section) that the devices are successfully communicating by using IPsec.

segment.source: If there are problems with GPO deployment, or errors in configuration of one or more of the IPsec GPOs, devices can continue to operate, because request mode enables any device to fall back to clear communications.
segment.target: If there are problems with GPO deployment, or errors in configuration of one or more of the IPsec GPOs, devices can continue to operate, because request mode enables any device to fall back to clear communications.

segment.source: Only after you have added all of the devices to their zones, and you have confirmed that communications are working as expected, you can start changing the request mode rules to require mode rules where it is required in the zones.
segment.target: Only after you have added all of the devices to their zones, and you have confirmed that communications are working as expected, you can start changing the request mode rules to require mode rules where it is required in the zones.

segment.source: We recommend that you enable require mode in the zones one zone at a time, pausing to confirm that they are functioning properly before you continue.
segment.target: We recommend that you enable require mode in the zones one zone at a time, pausing to confirm that they are functioning properly before you continue.

segment.source: Turn the required mode setting on for the server isolation zones first, then the encryption zone, and then the isolated domain.
segment.target: Turn the required mode setting on for the server isolation zones first, then the encryption zone, and then the isolated domain.

segment.source: Do not change the boundary zone GPO, because it must stay in request mode for both inbound and outbound connections.
segment.target: Do not change the boundary zone GPO, because it must stay in request mode for both inbound and outbound connections.

segment.source: If you create other zones that require either inbound or outbound require mode, make the setting change in a manner that applies the setting in stages from the smaller groups of devices to the larger groups.
segment.target: If you create other zones that require either inbound or outbound require mode, make the setting change in a manner that applies the setting in stages from the smaller groups of devices to the larger groups.

segment.source: Example Woodgrove Bank deployment plans
segment.target: Example Woodgrove Bank deployment plans

segment.source: Woodgrove Bank links all its GPOs to the domain level container in the Active Directory OU hierarchy.
segment.target: Woodgrove Bank links all its GPOs to the domain level container in the Active Directory OU hierarchy.

segment.source: It then uses the following WMI filters and security group filters to control the application of the GPOs to the correct subset of devices.
segment.target: It then uses the following WMI filters and security group filters to control the application of the GPOs to the correct subset of devices.

segment.source: All of the GPOs have the User Configuration section disabled to improve performance.
segment.target: All of the GPOs have the User Configuration section disabled to improve performance.

segment.source: GPODOMISOFirewall
segment.target: GPODOMISOFirewall

segment.source: WMI filter.
segment.target: WMI filter.

segment.source: The WMI filter allows this GPO to apply only to devices that match the following WMI query:
segment.target: The WMI filter allows this GPO to apply only to devices that match the following WMI query:

segment.source: Note: This excludes domain controllers (which report a ProductType value of 2).
segment.target: Note: This excludes domain controllers (which report a ProductType value of 2).

segment.source: Do not include domain controllers in the isolated domain if there are devices running versions of Windows earlier than Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Do not include domain controllers in the isolated domain if there are devices running versions of Windows earlier than Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Security filter.
segment.target: Security filter.

segment.source: This GPO grants Read and Apply Group Policy permissions only to devices that are members of the group CGDOMISOIsolatedDomain.
segment.target: This GPO grants Read and Apply Group Policy permissions only to devices that are members of the group CGDOMISOIsolatedDomain.

segment.source: The GPO also explicitly denies Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to members of the CGDOMISONOIPSEC.
segment.target: The GPO also explicitly denies Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to members of the CGDOMISONOIPSEC.

segment.source: GPODOMISOIsolatedDomainClients
segment.target: GPODOMISOIsolatedDomainClients

segment.source: WMI filter.
segment.target: WMI filter.

segment.source: The WMI filter allows this GPO to apply only to devices that match the following WMI query:
segment.target: The WMI filter allows this GPO to apply only to devices that match the following WMI query:

segment.target: This GPO grants Read and Apply Group Policy permissions only to devices that are members of the group CGDOMISOIsolatedDomain.

segment.source: The GPO also explicitly denies Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to members of the group CGDOMISONOIPSEC.
segment.target: The GPO also explicitly denies Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to members of the group CGDOMISONOIPSEC.

segment.target: GPODOMISOIsolatedDomainServers

segment.target: The WMI filter allows this GPO to apply only to devices that match the following WMI query:

segment.target: This GPO grants Read and Apply permissions in Group Policy only to devices that are members of the group CGDOMISOEncryption.
